faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Vizsla?
faqs.answer: Yes. Vizslas face epilepsy, hip dysplasia, and higher cancer risk. Their athletic nature also means more injury potential. Insurance is recommended.

faqs.question: Do Vizslas have epilepsy?
faqs.answer: Epilepsy occurs more frequently in Vizslas than many breeds. It typically appears between 1-5 years and requires lifelong medication.

faqs.question: Are Vizslas prone to cancer?
faqs.answer: They have higher rates of certain cancers including hemangiosarcoma and mast cell tumors. Unlimited coverage is valuable for potential cancer treatment.

faqs.question: Do Vizslas have allergy problems?
faqs.answer: Yes—skin and food allergies are relatively common. They may need special diets and ongoing medication.

faqs.question: How long do Vizslas live?
faqs.answer: 12-14 years typically. Their longevity and active lifestyle make insurance a good long-term investment.
